to be very blunt... i believe I will not benefit at all from the latest stupid anti-scam measures. it only serves to inconvenience me
all these safeguards feel like inconveniences until they save you your life‚Äôs savings one day. just count your blessings and don‚Äôt assume it will never happen to you
yeah this is the official message from government....but i feel it actually makes people less vigilant. Now they think they can don't care since onus is on the bank to protect them.
i guess they figured since people aren‚Äôt doing their part  they need stronger measures otherwise they will say the bank dw help them when they kena scammed
Exactly. Plus  moving out 200k should not be as easy as moving 2k. Even just one additional phone call check would be worth the hassle for significantly more security.
they didn't factor in people who legitimately need to move money around frequently and fully aware of the risks involved.
True. Then it should be free to opt out of such security measures
yes that was what i offered to the Anti Fraud officer who called in.. he said not possible...

The other recent irritant that tightened is Interest Bearing Balances.Last time  over $120k annual income  nobody bothers. Recently  got DPs of banks clamping down even if you earn above $120k annual income and you have Interest Bearing Balances above your 12 months Income ON RECORD with them.They don't even bother to find out why customer has the Interest Bearing Balances before they reduce your limit.So the strategy of taking cheap Balance Transfers to put into High Yield Savings Accounts is very dangerous now.

Oh ya  you are absolutely right on this point! The banks don't share their clients info so they won't know you are transferring to yourself!

Hmm you may be right.Bank A won't know Bank B's actual beneficiary (you indeed can put nonsense).BUT Bank B will know Bank A's account name.When you FAST from Bank A to Bank B  Bank B entry will have the account sender's name.So whenever possible  I still try to do first party (same name to same name transfers) to avoid the receiving bank asking questions. However  this doesn't solve the issue at hand which is Bank A blocking the transfer to Bank B! (NO SOLUTION!!!!)
